intro: Chlamydanthus nitidus, commonly known as the glossy chlamydanthus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Scrophulariaceae. It is characterized by its dense, hairy leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. Native to regions of southern Africa, this plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun exposure. The flowers are typically visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
